item.title: Lebanon-Israel truce committee talks widen
item.description: The committee overseeing the Hezbollah-Israel truce in Lebanon focused on Friday on how to return displaced people to their homes, addressing civilian issues to help prevent renewed war if a year-end deadline to disarm Hezbollah is not met. The 15th meeting of the committee reflected a long-standi

item.title: Election 2026: 450,000 Bangladeshi expats registered to vote
item.description: More than 450,000 expatriate Bangladeshi voters from different countries across the world registered through a mobile app, ‘Postal Vote Bd’, in the last one month to vote in the upcoming national election and the referendum, scheduled to be held simultaneously on February 12, 2026. The

item.title: BNP pays homage to Osman Hadi
item.description: BNP on Friday paid tributes to Inquilab Moncho spokesperson Sharif Osman Hadi as his body arrived at Hazrat Shahjalal International Airport from Singapore on Friday evening. On behalf of the party, BNP Standing Committee member Salahuddin Ahmed and Acting Chairman’s adviser Dr Mahdi Amin pai

item.title: Fire breaks out at Udichi office in Dhaka
item.description: A fire has broken out following an attack at the Udichi Shilpigosthi office near the National Press Club in Dhaka. Firefighters rushed to the scene to control the blaze around 7:30pm on Friday evening. Jamshed Anwar Topon, general secretary of one faction of Udichi, told bdnews24.com: “The

item.title: Hadi to be buried beside Kazi Nazrul
item.description: Inqilab Moncho Convenor Sharif Osman bin Hadi will be buried beside the grave of national poet Kazi Nazrul Islam next to the Dhaka University Central Mosque, confirmed the platform in a Facebook Post. Hadi’s family wished to have him buried at the place, the Inqilab Moncho said in the post o

item.title: Chhayanaut ‘will not waver’
item.description: Chhayanaut will remain steadfast in its journey, the Bengali cultural organisation has said following the arson attack and widespread vandalism on its premises on Friday. Around 6:30pm on Saturday, the statement signed by the organisation’s President Sarwar Ali and General Secretary Laisa Ah

item.title: Bangladesh issues travel pass for Tarique Rahman
item.description: The Bangladesh high commission in London has issued a travel pass for Tarique Rahman in response to the BNP leader’s application for the document, an official said. A foreign ministry official, who spoke on condition of anonymity, said Friday the mission took just a day to issue the travel d

item.title: Govt accountable for attacks on media: TIB
item.description: The Transparency International Bangladesh (TIB) has said the Muhammad Yunus-led interim government cannot deny responsibility for the attack on media, describing it as an assault on free media, dissent, and freedom of speech. The TIB, local chapter of Berlin-based Transparency International—

item.title: UN calls for calm, urges all to refrain from violence
item.description: The United Nations Human Rights Office urges all to remain calm and to refrain from violence in the wake of the death of July protester Sharif Osman Hadi and the violence after the death. Jeremy Laurence, UN Human Rights Office spokesperson, on Friday said, “We are deeply troubled by t

item.title: BFUJ, DUJ condemn attacks on offices of Prothom Alo, Daily Star
item.description: Bangladesh Federal Union of Journalists-BFUJ and Dhaka Union of Journalists-DUJ have expressed deep concern over the arson attacks on the offices of Daily Prothom Alo and The Daily Star. In a joint statement, the journalists’ bodies condemned and protested against the incidents, saying that

item.title: 446th board meeting of Al-Arafah Islami Bank held
item.description: 446th Board meeting of Al-Arafah Islami Bank PLC was held on Thursday, at the Banks’ Head Office, according to a press release. Chairman of the Board of Directors Khwaja Shahriar presided over the meeting. The overall business performance of the Bank was reviewed and several policy decisions

item.title: Sonali Bank distributes blankets at Sakhipur in Tangail
item.description: Sonali Bank PLC distributed blankets among poor, helpless, and uprooted people who are suffering from biting cold at Sakhipur, Tangail, under the Corporate Social Responsibilities (CSR) activities. Bank’s MD & CEO Md. Shawkat Ali Khan handed over blankets to cold-hit people at Takterchala Go
